info.description: An API that allows querying of Erskine May data.
info.title: Erskine May API

parameters.description: Chapter overview with the chapter number specified
parameters.name: chapterNumber

get.summary: Returns a single chapter overview by chapter number.

parameters.description: The number of records to skip from the first, default is 0.
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: The number of records to return, default is 20, maximum is 20.
parameters.name: take

get.summary: Returns a list of index terms by start letter.
Returns an index term by id.
Returns a list of all parts.
Returns a part by part number.

parameters.description: Index terms which contain search term.
parameters.name: searchTerm

parameters.description: The number of records to skip from the first, default is 0.
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: The number of records to return, default is 20, maximum is 20.
parameters.name: take

get.summary: Returns a list of index terms which contain the search term.
Returns a section overview by reference.

parameters.description: Paragraphs which contain search term in their content.
parameters.name: searchTerm

parameters.description: The number of records to skip from the first, default is 0.
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: The number of records to return, default is 20, maximum is 20.
parameters.name: take

get.summary: Returns a list of paragraphs which contain the search term.

parameters.description: Sections which contain search term in their title.
parameters.name: searchTerm

parameters.description: The number of records to skip from the first, default is 0.
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: The number of records to return, default is 20, maximum is 20.
parameters.name: take

get.summary: Returns a list of sections which contain the search term.
Returns a section by section id.

parameters.description: Number of sections to step over from given section.
parameters.name: step

get.summary: Returns a section overview by section id and step.
